forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers and patchy fog. Cloudy. Low around 36, with temperatures rising to around 44 overnight. East wind around 14 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: New Year's Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers and patchy fog before 1pm, then patchy fog and a slight chance of rain showers. Cloudy, with a high near 49. Northwest wind 6 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the quiet of the early morning drapes itself over Boston, a veil of rain showers mingles with the fog, wrapping the city in a muted embrace. The air is drenched with a brisk chill, a gentle reminder that winter's grasp still holds sway. With the temperature gradually climbing, the promise of a milder day lies ahead, though the clouds will linger, casting a soft gray light upon the streets. As the clock strikes noon, the rhythmic patter of rain is set to yield to intermittent patches of fog, creating a scene both tranquil and serene, with a hint of anticipation for clearer skies.

Dressing for this day requires a thoughtful layering of warmth against the chilly dampness—a cozy sweater beneath a weather-resistant coat, complemented by waterproof footwear to navigate the puddles that will form as the rain persists. Umbrellas will serve as loyal companions, if only to fend off the sporadic showers. With the mist embracing the city, it is an ideal time for leisurely strolls through the art-filled galleries of the South End or enjoying a steaming cup of coffee in a quaint café, where one can watch as the world moves slowly outside. The intriguing interplay of rain and fog presents an invitation to savor the subtleties of a January day rather than resist it.
